page.title: 12INTERESTING VENTNOR PERSON.
page.content: Basil Drake was born in Ventnor in 1902. He now lives in a house made of wood in Spring Hill. At the beginning of the First World War he went to the New Forest with the Scouts for a week and that is the longest time he has been off the Island. He remembers the time when there was only one car in Ventnor. He used to travel by train. He was a cinema projectionist in three Ventnor Cinemas for 60 years They have all closed now. One of his first jobs was to go around Ventnor turning off the street lights. He remembers the horse-drawn ambulance that took children to the Isolation Hospital. Sadly the number of old respected Ventnor-born characters is diminishing with the large influx of 'overners'.
